com.here.android.mpa.guidance

Class NavigationManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.android.mpa.guidance.NavigationManager

  • public final class NavigationManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class controls turn by turn navigation.

    If the user of the application revokes the ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION permission at runtime while NavigationManager is active, navigation will stop functioning. Navigation must be restarted once the ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION permission is restored.

      • simulate

        public NavigationManager.Error simulate(Route route,
                                        long speed)
        Start route simulation.

        Route simulation should only be used for testing purposes. Do not use this feature in a production application.

        IMPORTANT: Navigation for route that was calculated for RouteOptions.TransportMode.BICYCLE is a Beta feature, and is subject to change without notice.

        Parameters:
        route - The route to use.
        speed - simulation speed in meter per second. Valid range is 0 - 4294967295.
        Returns:
        NavigationManager.Error.NONE if operation was successful, otherwise one of the other error codes in Error. NavigationManager.Error.INVALID_PARAMETERS if route is null or is an online public transit or online urban mobility route (route with TransportMode set to RouteOptions.TransportMode.PUBLIC_TRANSPORT or calculated using UMRouter). NavigationManager.Error.INVALID_OPERATION if LocationDataSourceAutomotive is provided as position source but a non-automotive route is used ( route with TransportMode NOT set to RouteOptions.TransportMode.CAR). NavigationManager.Error.OPERATION_NOT_ALLOWED if access to this operation is denied.

      • startNavigation

        public NavigationManager.Error startNavigation(Route route)
        Start navigation along the route.

        IMPORTANT: Navigation for route that was calculated for RouteOptions.TransportMode.BICYCLE is a Beta feature, and is subject to change without notice.

        Parameters:
        route - The Route to use.
        Returns:
        NavigationManager.Error.NONE if operation was successful, otherwise one of the other error codes in Error. NavigationManager.Error.INVALID_PARAMETERS if route is null or is an online public transit or online urban mobility route (route with TransportMode set to RouteOptions.TransportMode.PUBLIC_TRANSPORT or calculated using UMRouter). NavigationManager.Error.INVALID_OPERATION if LocationDataSourceAutomotive is provided as position source but a non-automotive route is used ( route with TransportMode NOT set to RouteOptions.TransportMode.CAR). NavigationManager.Error.OPERATION_NOT_ALLOWED if access to this operation is denied.

        Sets the route navigation manager should use.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        NavigationManager.Error.NONE if operation was successful, otherwise one of the other error codes in Error. NavigationManager.Error.INVALID_PARAMETERS if route is null or is an online public transit or online urban mobility route (route with TransportMode set to RouteOptions.TransportMode.PUBLIC_TRANSPORT or calculated using UMRouter). NavigationManager.Error.INVALID_OPERATION if LocationDataSourceAutomotive is provided as position source but a non-automotive route is used ( route with TransportMode NOT set to RouteOptions.TransportMode.CAR). NavigationManager.Error.OPERATION_NOT_ALLOWED if access to this operation is denied.

      • setDistanceToTriggerStopoverReached

        public void setDistanceToTriggerStopoverReached(int distance)
        Sets the distance threshold that will be used to consider that stop waypoint and/or destination has been reached. This value will be used for all subsequent NavigationManager.startNavigation(Route) with arbitrary RouteOptions.TransportMode.

        Default value is 5 meters.

        Parameters:
        distance - The distance from the current position to the upcoming stopover in meters when SDK should trigger NavigationManager.NavigationManagerEventListener.onStopoverReached(int) callback.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If distance is less or equal 0.
        See Also:
        NavigationManager.NavigationManagerEventListener.onStopoverReached(int), NavigationManager.addNavigationManagerEventListener(WeakReference)

      • setDistanceWithUTurnToTriggerStopoverReached

        public void setDistanceWithUTurnToTriggerStopoverReached(int distance)
        Sets the distance threshold that will be used to consider that stop waypoint and/or destination has been reached with u-turn. SDK will trigger NavigationManager.NavigationManagerEventListener.onStopoverReached(int) if driver makes a u-turn within provided distance to the upcoming stopover. This value will be used for all subsequent NavigationManager.startNavigation(Route) with arbitrary RouteOptions.TransportMode.

        Default value is 50 meters.

        Parameters:
        distance - The distance from the current position to the upcoming stopover in meters when SDK should trigger NavigationManager.NavigationManagerEventListener.onStopoverReached(int) callback.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If distance is less or equal 0.
        See Also:
        NavigationManager.NavigationManagerEventListener.onStopoverReached(int), NavigationManager.addNavigationManagerEventListener(WeakReference)

      • setDistanceAndStopTimeToTriggerStopoverReached

        public void setDistanceAndStopTimeToTriggerStopoverReached(int distance,
                                                           int time)
        Sets the distance threshold along with stop time that will be used to consider that stop waypoint and/or destination has been reached. Driver's stop time should be higher than provided time and within provided distance to the upcoming stopover in order to make SDK trigger callback. This value will be used for all subsequent NavigationManager.startNavigation(Route) with arbitrary RouteOptions.TransportMode.

        Default stop time is 3 sec. Default distance for RouteOptions.TransportMode.PEDESTRIAN is 10 meters, for others is 30 meters.

        Parameters:
        distance - The distance from the current position to the upcoming stopover in meters when SDK should trigger NavigationManager.NavigationManagerEventListener.onStopoverReached(int) callback.
        time - The time in seconds that driver stops and waits within provided distance to the upcoming stopover.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If distance or time is less or equal 0.
        See Also:
        NavigationManager.NavigationManagerEventListener.onStopoverReached(int), NavigationManager.addNavigationManagerEventListener(WeakReference)

      • setRouteRequestInterval

        public NavigationManager.Error setRouteRequestInterval(int value)
        Set the time period between two re-routing. Default interval is 5 minutes. This time period is applicable when NavigationManager.TrafficAvoidanceMode.DYNAMIC or NavigationManager.TrafficAvoidanceMode.MANUAL is in use.
        Parameters:
        value - The new route request interval in seconds
        Returns:
        NavigationManager.Error.NONE if operation was successful, otherwise one of the other error codes in Error.
        See Also:
        NavigationManager.setTrafficAvoidanceMode(TrafficAvoidanceMode)

      • getTta

        public RouteTta getTta(Route.TrafficPenaltyMode mode,
                       boolean wholeRoute)
        Returns the Time To Arrival (TTA).
        Parameters:
        mode - The Route.TrafficPenaltyMode to use for the calculation.
        wholeRoute - True to return the TTA for the whole route, false to return the TTA for the next stopover waypoint.
        Returns:
        The current RouteTta. Can be null if not currently in guidance.

      • getTta

        public RouteTta getTta(Route.TrafficPenaltyMode mode,
                       int subleg)
        Returns the Time To Arrival (TTA) to the end of the specified route subleg.
        Parameters:
        mode - The Route.TrafficPenaltyMode to use for the calculation.
        subleg - The subleg number to use or Route.WHOLE_ROUTE for the whole route.
        Returns:
        The RouteTta for the route subleg or null if the NavigationManager currently is not in guidance state.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the subleg doesn't exist.

      • setDistanceUnit

        public NavigationManager.Error setDistanceUnit(NavigationManager.UnitSystem us)
        Sets the measuring unit system that is used by voice guidance. The default UnitSystem is NavigationManager.UnitSystem.METRIC.

        Note: If a new VoiceSkin is selected and it does not support the currently selected UnitSystem then NavigationManager will default to NavigationManager.UnitSystem.METRIC. It is recommended that after calling VoiceGuidanceOptions.setVoiceSkin(VoiceSkin) then NavigationManager.setDistanceUnit(NavigationManager.UnitSystem) be also called to setup the appropriate UnitSystem.

        Parameters:
        us - The desired NavigationManager.UnitSystem to be used.
        Returns:
        NavigationManager.Error.NONE if operation was successful, NavigationManager.Error.INVALID_OPERATION if the selected VoiceSkin does not support the desired unit system. otherwise one of the other error codes in Error.
        See Also:
        VoiceGuidanceOptions.setVoiceSkin(VoiceSkin)

      • getDistanceUnit

        public NavigationManager.UnitSystem getDistanceUnit()
        Gets the Distance Unit. This is the measure unit used for voice guidance
        Returns:
        The NavigationManager.UnitSystem currently in use.

      • setNaturalGuidanceMode

        public boolean setNaturalGuidanceMode(java.util.EnumSet<NavigationManager.NaturalGuidanceMode> mode)
        Set the natural guidance modes to be enabled. By default, all of the natural guidance modes are disabled.
        Parameters:
        mode - One or more natural guidance modes to be enabled
        Returns:
        True if all modes were set successfully. False otherwise.

      • setRealisticViewMode

        public void setRealisticViewMode(NavigationManager.RealisticViewMode mode)
        Change realistic view mode. By default the feature is off. By selecting day or night (and adding an aspect ratio with addRealisticViewAspectRatio(AspectRatio)) the feature is activated.
        Parameters:
        mode - The mode to set.
        Throws:
        java.security.AccessControlException - Access to this operation is denied. Contact your HERE representative for more information.

      • addRealisticViewAspectRatio

        public void addRealisticViewAspectRatio(NavigationManager.AspectRatio ratio)
        Adds an aspect ratio to the realistic view engine. By default all aspect ratios are off. Realistic view images are only generated for the requested aspect ratios.
        Parameters:
        ratio - The aspect ratio to be added.
        Throws:
        java.security.AccessControlException - Access to this operation is denied. Contact your HERE representative for more information.

      • getRealisticViewAspectRatios

        public java.util.EnumSet<NavigationManager.AspectRatio> getRealisticViewAspectRatios()
        Gets the aspect ratios currently being returned.
        Returns:
        The EnumSet of aspect ratios.

      • clearRealisticViewAspectRatios

        public void clearRealisticViewAspectRatios()
        Clear all aspect ratios from the realistic view engine. After this no images will be generated unless new aspect ratios are added with addRealisticViewAspectRatio(AspectRatio)).
        Throws:
        java.security.AccessControlException - Access to this operation is denied. Contact your HERE representative for more information.

      • setMapUpdateMode

        public NavigationManager.Error setMapUpdateMode(NavigationManager.MapUpdateMode mode)
        Sets the Map Update Mode, different modes changes the way position is updated. The default Map Update Mode is NavigationManager.MapUpdateMode.NONE.
        Parameters:
        mode - The desired NavigationManager.MapUpdateMode to be used.
        Returns:
        Any NavigationManager.Error that resulted from the update

      • setSpeedWarningOptions

        public NavigationManager.Error setSpeedWarningOptions(float lowSpeedOffset,
                                                      float highSpeedOffset,
                                                      float highSpeedBoundary)
        Set speed warning options. Speed warning is triggered by comparing current speed to speed limit with offset. i.e. if you exceed the speed limit beyond the given offset a warning will be issued Speed unit is is m/s. Operation fails if called before starting navigation, tracking or simulation. Operation fails when speed warner is not available or is not initialized (eg:in pedestrian mode).
        Parameters:
        lowSpeedOffset - Offset in low speeds.
        highSpeedOffset - Offset in high speeds.
        highSpeedBoundary - Boundary for high speed. Above this speed high speed offset is used and below low speed offset.
        Returns:
        NavigationManager.Error.NONE if operation was successful, otherwise one of the other error codes in Error.

      • getLowSpeedWarningOffset

        public float getLowSpeedWarningOffset()
        The current low speed warning offset in meters/second.
        Returns:
        Offset in low speeds in m/s.
        See Also:
        NavigationManager.setSpeedWarningOptions(float, float, float)

      • getHighSpeedWarningOffset

        public float getHighSpeedWarningOffset()
        The current high speed warning offset in meters/second.
        Returns:
        Offset in high speeds.
        See Also:
        NavigationManager.setSpeedWarningOptions(float, float, float)

      • getHighSpeedWarningBoundary

        public float getHighSpeedWarningBoundary()
        The current speed boundary in meters/second.
        Returns:
        Boundary for high speed.
        See Also:
        NavigationManager.setSpeedWarningOptions(float, float, float)

      • setSpeedWarningEnabled

        public boolean setSpeedWarningEnabled(boolean value)
        Set the speed warning state. The method makes it easy to turn on/off speed warning notifications during the same navigation session. The speed warning is automatically turned on when NavigationManager.setSpeedWarningOptions(float, float, float) is called. Operation fails if called before starting navigation, tracking or simulation. Operation also fails when speed warner is not available or is not initialized, (for example, in pedestrian mode). Operation fails if NavigationManager.stopSpeedWarning() has already been called for the current navigation session.
        Parameters:
        value - speed warning state. The boolean value true indicates that the speed warning is going to be turned on. The boolean value false indicates that the speed warning is going to be turned off.
        Returns:
        true if operation was successful , false otherwise.

      • isSpeedWarningEnabled

        public boolean isSpeedWarningEnabled()
        Get the speed warning status.
        Returns:
        true speed warning is enabled, false otherwise.

      • stopSpeedWarning

        public void stopSpeedWarning()
        Stop speed warning notifications for the current navigation session. After this method call, changing the speed warning state will have no effect during the current navigation session.

      • getEnabledAudioEvents

        public java.util.EnumSet<NavigationManager.AudioEvent> getEnabledAudioEvents()
        Gets the set of all NavigationManager.AudioEvents that are currently enabled. Safety spot (NavigationManager.AudioEvent.SAFETY_SPOT) and re-routing (NavigationManager.AudioEvent.ROUTE) audio events are disabled by default.
        Returns:
        The set of all enabled events.

      • setEnabledAudioEvents

        public void setEnabledAudioEvents(java.util.EnumSet<NavigationManager.AudioEvent> events)
        Used to enable/disable the playback of audio events during navigation. As the presence of an enum will enable the desired event, likewise the absence of an enum will disable the missing event.
        Parameters:
        events - The set of all NavigationManager.AudioEvents to be enabled.

      • getRunningState

        public NavigationManager.NavigationState getRunningState()
        Retrieves the current Navigation Running State
        Returns:
        The current NavigationManager.NavigationState

      • getTrafficWarner

        public TrafficWarner getTrafficWarner()
        Retrieve the traffic warner instance for the navigation manager
        Returns:
        The TrafficWarner instance currently in use.

      • setMap

        public void setMap(Map map)
        Set Map to this Navigation Manager object and show the Navigation on Map. Passing null will remove Navigation from the Map. Setting a new Map instance (e.g. setMap(Map1) => setMap(Map2)) will cause Navigation to be removed from Map1 and added to Map2.

        Note: Setting the map while Navigation is ongoing is not supported.

        Parameters:
        map - The Map to show the Navigation on.

      • getEta

        public java.util.Date getEta(boolean wholeRoute,
                             Route.TrafficPenaltyMode mode)
        Returns the estimated time of arrival (ETA) of the route.
        Parameters:
        wholeRoute - Calculate ETA for the whole route if true or for the current leg if false.
        mode - The TrafficPenaltyMode to use.
        Returns:
        A valid ETA date is returned when actively navigating on a route (when the navigation mode is NAVIGATION or SIMULATION). Note that when a navigation event is being handled (for example, during a route recalculation), a NavigationManager.INVALID_ETA_DATE can be returned. A NavigationManager.INVALID_ETA_DATE will also be returned if not actively navigating on a route.

      • getInstance

        public static NavigationManager getInstance()
        Returns:
        NavigationManager instance.

      • getTrafficAvoidanceMode

        public NavigationManager.TrafficAvoidanceMode getTrafficAvoidanceMode()
        Get the way in which traffic should be handled during navigation.
        Returns:
        The current NavigationManager.TrafficAvoidanceMode.

      • setTrafficAvoidanceMode

        public NavigationManager.Error setTrafficAvoidanceMode(NavigationManager.TrafficAvoidanceMode mode)
        Set the way in which traffic should be handled during navigation. Default NavigationManager.TrafficAvoidanceMode is NavigationManager.TrafficAvoidanceMode.DISABLE.
        Parameters:
        mode - The desired TrafficAvoidanceMode
        Returns:
        NavigationManager.Error.NONE if operation was successful, otherwise one of the other error codes in Error.

      • getCountryCode

        public java.lang.String getCountryCode()
        Gets the three-letter country code (defined in ISO 3166-1) from current location. Navigation session should be started for this method to work.
        Returns:
        The country code from current location. null if the information is not available.
        Throws:
        java.security.AccessControlException - Access to this operation is denied. Contact your HERE representative for more information.

      • getTruckRestrictions

        public java.util.List<TruckRestriction> getTruckRestrictions(RoadElement element,
                                                             RouteOptions options)
        Gets the truck restrictions for specific road element.
        Parameters:
        element - The road element which may contain truck restriction.
        options - Route options with truck transport mode.
        Returns:
        The list of TruckRestriction.
        Note:
        Truck restrictions available only in RouteOptions.TransportMode.TRUCK. This method can be used before active navigation started.

        Returns:

        public void addTruckRestrictionListener(java.lang.ref.WeakReference<NavigationManager.TruckRestrictionListener> listener)

        Only those routes that were calculated with RouteOptions.setTruckRestrictionsMode(PENALIZE_VIOLATIONS) can contain violated truck restrictions.

        Parameters:

      • getRemainingDistance

        public int getRemainingDistance(int routeElementIndex,
                                GeoCoordinate positionOnElement)
        Returns the remaining distance to the given position on the route.
        Parameters:
        routeElementIndex - Index of the route element.
        positionOnElement - Position on the route element.
        Returns:
        The distance in meters. Returns Integer.MAX_VALUE if an error occured or if the given position has been already reached.

      • getRemainingDistance

        public int getRemainingDistance(int subleg)
        Returns the remaining distance to the end of the specified leg of the route.
        Parameters:
        subleg - The subleg number to use or Route.WHOLE_ROUTE for the whole route.
        Returns:
        The distance in meters. Returns Integer.MAX_VALUE if an error occurred or if the end of given route leg has been already reached.

      • getCurrentRouteLeg

        public int getCurrentRouteLeg()
        Returns the current route leg.
        Returns:
        The current route leg. Returns Integer.MAX_VALUE if an error occured.
